rule.title: Acid Storm
rule.line: You evoke a storm of acid rain that pelts the area for the duration. A creature that begins its turn in the area takes 3d8 acid damage (basic Reflex save).
rule.heighten: The damage increases by 1d8.

rule.title: Banishment
rule.targets: 1 creature that isn't on its home plane
rule.line: You send the target back to its home plane. The target must attempt a Will save. You can spend an extra action while Casting the Spell and add a cost to the spell to give the creature a -2 circumstance penalty to its save. The cost must be a specially gathered object that is anathema to the creature. This spell fails if you aren't on your home plane when you cast it.

line.critsuccess: The target resists being banished and you are stunned 1.
line.critfail: The target is banished and can't return by any means to the plane it's banished from for 1 week.

rule.heighten: You can target up to 10 creatures. The extra cost affects targets to which it is anathema.

rule.title: Blazing Fissure
rule.line: A thin crack rips through the earth, erupting with with magma, then swiftly seals up. Each creature along the line and on solid ground takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage and 6d6 fire damage with a basic Reflex save. If the creature fails or critically fails its save, it falls prone.
rule.heighten: The damage increases by 1d6 bludgeoning and 1d6 fire.

rule.title: Blister
rule.line: You point at a target in range, and its skin grows searing blisters filled with caustic fluid. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

You can spend a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to pop a blister. The target and each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from the target takes 7d6 acid damage (basic Reflex save). You choose the direction of the cone, which can't include the target. When no blisters are left, the spell ends.
rule.heighten: The damage of a popped blister increases by 1d6.

rule.title: Chameleon Coat
rule.line: You shift the colors of the target' outermost layer of clothing and gear to be closer to their environment when they remain still. Creatures affected by the spell gain a +4 status bonus to Stealth checks to Hide. The changed color granted by the spell always shifts to match the environment, even if there are drastic changes. If any piece of gear affected by the spell is removed from a creature, the spell ends for that creature.
rule.heighten: If a creature affected by this spell rolls a critical failure on its Stealth check to Sneak within 30 feet of a creature that would spot it, it instead only fails its check, as the spell mildly hypnotizes the spotter.
As 6th rank, and the status bonus is +4.

rule.title: Confusing Cry
rule.line: You give an unsettling, warbling cry that causes nearby creatures to lash out without control. Each creature in the area that can hear must attempt a Will save.

line.critsuccess: The target is unaffected and immune to this spell for 1 minute.
line.fail: The target is confused for the duration. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the spell for itself.
line.critfail: As failure, and the creature immediatelyu attacks itself. This Strike doesn't give the creature a flat check to recover from the confusion.

rule.title: Corrosive Muck
rule.line: You create two puddles of acidic slime that hinders the movement of anyone who walks through them. The area of each pool becomes greater difficult terrain. Each round that a creature starts its turn in one of the pools or enters a pool during a move action it's using, it takes 8d6 acid damage with a basic Reflex save. A creature that critically fails its saving throw also takes 1d6 persistent acid damage.
As normal, if a Large or larger creature starts its turn in both pools, it takes the damage only once.
rule.heighten: Create an additional 10-foot burst.

rule.title: Death Ward
rule.line: You shield a creature from the ravages of void energy. For the duration, the target gains a +4 status bonus to saves against death and void effects, gain void resistance 10, and suppresses the effects of the doomed condition.

rule.title: Elemental Breath
rule.line: You open a miniature portal to an elemental plane within your mouth, then exhale a powerful explosion of the plane's element. Roll 1d6 to determine the element. If you used 3 actions to Cast this Spell, you can choose the element instead. This spell gains the trait matching the element.
Each creature in the cone must attempt a basic Reflex save.

line.entry: Strong winds and lightning strikes buffer creatures in the cone, dealing 6d10 electricity damage. A creature that fails its save is also pushed 10 feet.
Mud deals 5d10 bludgeoning damage to creatures in the area. A creature on the ground that fails its save slips and falls prone.
Surging fire deals 7d10 fire damage in the cone.

Rust slices flesh and damage metal in the cone. Each creature takes 5d10 slashing damage. A creature made of metal gets a result one degree worse than what it rolled, and an unattended metal object gets a critical failure.
A torrent of chilled water deals 3d10 cold damage and 3d10 bludgeoning damage in the cone.
Branches rip through creatures, dealing 3d10 piercing damage and 3d10 slashing damage in the cone. Ground in the area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute.

rule.heighten: The damage increases by 1d10. For water and wood, you can choose which damage type increases for each rank the spell is heightened.

rule.title: Entwined Roots
rule.line: Slithering roots gird you and your allies in layers of flexible wooden protection. Each affected creature gains resistance 5 to bludgeoning and piercing damage. Whenever a creature protected by these roots is targeted by a ranged weapon attack but takes no damage (such as if the attack missed or the damage was reduced to 0 by resistance), the roots snatch up the ammunition or throw weapon and hold it. The protected creature can retrieve the thrown weapon or ammunition as an Interact action.
rule.heighten: The resistances increase to 10.
The resistances increase to 15.

rule.title: Flammable Fumes
rule.line: Sending magic deep underground, you conjure a cloud of toxic gases that swiftly degenerate into volatile fumes. The gases are invisible, requiring a successful Perception check against your spell DC to detect visually, though their acrid smell and toxic effects are clear once a creature has entered the cloud.
A creature that enters the cloud or is within the cloud at the start of its turn takes 2d6 poison damage. A creature can take the poison damage from flammable fumes only once per round.

One round after you conjure the cloud, the gases lose stability and become flammable. If an open flame is brought into the cloud, or if anyone within the area uses a fire effect, the cloud detonates in a massive blaze that deals 10d6 fire damage with a basic Reflex save to all creatures within it, and the spell ends.
rule.heighten: The poison damage increases by 1d6, and the fire damage increases by 2d6.

rule.title: Freezing Rain
rule.line: Intense cold rain comes from nowhere, a microcosm of a sudden downpour, and a magical tweak can turn the rain to freezing sleet. The driving rain and pooling water make the area difficult terrain and extinguish non-magical fires.

On subsequent rounds, the first time you Sustain the spell each round, you can move the area up to 20 feet and can also freeze the rain. If you freeze the rain, each creature in the area takes 4d6 cold damage with a basic Reflex save. A creature that fails its saving throw is also slowed 1 for 1 round (slowed 2 for 1 round on a critical failure).
rule.heighten: The damage increases by 1d6.

rule.title: Geyser
rule.line: A powerful geyser blasts up from the ground, potentially pushing creatures on top of it into the air. The bottom of this spell's area must be on solid ground. Each creature in the area takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and 4d6 fire damage, with a Reflex save.

line.success: The creature takes half damage and isn't pushed into the air.
line.fail: The creature takes full damage and is pushed 20 feet into the air.
line.critfail: The creature takes double damage and is pushed 40 feet into the air.

rule.line: A creature pushed into the air by the geyser can't be pushed beyond the top of the geyser. After being pushed into the air, a creature falls unless it's flying or has some other means of staying aloft, taking falling damage (normally equal to half the distance it fell).
After the geyser erupts, its area is filled with a cloud of steam for 1 round. All creatures in the steam are concealed, and all creatures outside the steam are concealed to creatures within it.
rule.heighten: The damage increases by 1d6 bludgeoning and 1d6 fire.

rule.title: Grisly Growth
rule.line: This gruesome spell causes the target to grow excess limbs and organs, whether it be fingers multiplying until hands resemble bushes, eyes popping open in bizarre places, legs sprouting from the side of the body, or some other result. The target takes 10d6 piercing damage (basic Fortitude save) as the new features erupt. This spell has no effect on a target with a mutable anatomy or no limbs, such as an ooze or a protean. The growths rot rapidly and fall away after 1 round.

In addition, unless the initial target critically succeeds, creatures within 30 feet of the target, including the target, must attempt Will saves, after which they're temporary immune to this secondary effect of grissly growths for 1 hour. This additional effect is a mental and visual effect.
rule.heighten: The damage increases by 2d6.

rule.title: Howling Blizzard
rule.line: Freezing winds extend from your hands, pushing away from you with great force. If you Cast this Spell with 2 actions, it has an area of a 60-foot cone; if you Cast this Spell with 3 actions, it has a range of 500 feet and an area of a 30-foot burst. Each creature in the area takes 10d6 cold damage with a basic Reflex save.
Snowdrifts and icy gales fill the area until the start of your next turn, making the area difficult terrain.
rule.heighten: The damage increases by 2d6.

rule.title: Impaling Spike
rule.line: You conjure a spike that thrusts up from the earth beneath a target creature, potentially impaling it. The spike is made of cold iron and deals 8d6 piercing damage. The target must attempt a Reflex save.

line.critsuccess: The target dodges the spike and is unaffected.
line.success: The target is truck by the spike and takes half damage.
line.fail: The target is impaled through the leg or another non-vital body part. The creature takes full damage and, if it's standing on solid ground, becomes immobilized. It can attempt to Escape (the DC is your spell DC). While it remains impaled, it takes damage from any weakness to cold iron at has at the end of each of its turns.
line.critfail: As failure, but the creature is impaled through a vital organ or its center of mass, taking double damage, and it is off-guard as long as it is impaled.

rule.heighten: The damage increases by 2d6.

rule.title: Lightning Storm
rule.line: You create a black, rumbling storm cloud and call down one lightning bolt within the spell's area. The bolt is a vertical line from the top of the storm cloud to the ground below, dealing 4d12 electricity damage to creatures in the line (basic Reflex save). On subsequent rounds, the first time you Sustain the spell each round, you can call another lightning bolt within the area.
If you Cast this Spell outdoors, you can create two nonoverlapping clouds instead of one, though you can still call down only one bolt per turn.
rule.heighten: The damage of each bolt increases by 1d12.

rule.title: Mantle of the Unwavering Heart
rule.line: Vines and branches envelop you in an instant, growing a wild bloom of colors that open to reveal your new form. Upon Casting this Spell, pick two of the options below. As a single action, which has the concentrate trait, you can change one of your chosen abilities to a different option from the list.

line.entry: You gain fast healing 3 and a +2 status bonus to saves against poison and disease. This effect has the healing and vitality traits.

A cloud of potent floral scent surrounds you in a 15-foot radius. This effect has the aura and olfactory traits. Creatures in the aura can't benefit from the scent ability and are sickened 1 as long as they remain in the aura. The sickness is a disease effect.

You grow to a considerable height. Increase your size to Large. You're clumsy 1. Your reach increases by 5 feet (or by 10 feet if you started out Tiny), and you gain a grasping branch unarmed attack; this attack is in the brawling weapon group and deals 2d8 bludgeoning damage with the Grab monster ability.
Your mind becomes incredibly resilient to change. You're immune to being fascinated, and you get a +1 status bonus to saves and DCs against mental effects.

rule.title: Mariner's Curse
rule.line: You afflict the target with the curse of the roiling, unforgiving sea. The target must attempt a Will save.

line.success: The target becomes sickened 1. Reducing its sickened condition to 0 ends the curse.
line.fail: The target becomes sickened 1 and can't reduce its sickened condition below 1 while the curse remains. While the target is sickened and on the water at least 1 mile from shore, it is also slowed 1.
line.critfail: As failure, but the target becomes sickened 2.

rule.line: The curse can be lifted by 4th-rank cleanse affliction or similar magic, as normal.

rule.title: Moon Frenzy
rule.line: A feral aspect overcomes the targets, filling them with strength and ferocity. Targets gain 5 temporary Hit Points, a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds, and weakness 5 to silver. They also grow vicious fangs and claws, which are unarmed attacks. The fangs deal 2d8 piercing damage; the claws deal 2d6 slashing damage and have the agile and finesse traits. The targets use their highest weapon or unarmed attack proficiency with these attacks, and if they have weapon specialization or greater weapon specialization, they add this damage as well. On a critical hit with one of these unarmed attacks, the creature struck takes 1d4 persistent bleed damage.

The targets can't use concentrate actions unless those actions also have the rage trait, with the exception of Seek. A creature can attempt to end the spell's effect on itself by using a single action, which has the rage trait, to attempt a Will save against your spell DC; on a success, it ends the spell's effect on itself.
If a target is in the light of a full moon, it also grows by one size if it were Medium or smaller. This increases the reach of a Medium or Tiny creature by 5 feet.
rule.heighten: The temporary Hit Points increase to 10, the silver weakness to 10, and the damage dealt by the attacks to three dice.
The temporary Hit Points increase to 20, the silver weakness to 20, and the damage dealt by the attacks to four dice.

rule.title: Pressure Zone
rule.line: Air pressure drops precipitously, causing pain and debilitation in creatures' inner ears and joints. Each living creature in the area of the spell when you cast it or that enters the area during the spell's duration must attempt a Fortitude save.

line.success: he creature is deafened and clumsy 1 until the end of its next turn, after which it's temporarily immune for 1 hour.
line.fail: The creature is deafened and clumsy 2.
At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new save if it's no longer in the pressure zone. On a success, it ends the effects and is temporarily immune for 1 hour.
line.critfail: The creature is deafened and clumsy 2 for the duration of the spell.

rule.line: A creature deafened by this spell can attempt to end the condition by popping its ears. It can use a single action to attempt a new Fortitude save, losing the deafened condition from this spell on a success. Some creatures with anatomies that lack inner ears or joints might be immune to these effects, as determined by the GM.

rule.title: Wall of Stone
rule.line: You shape a wall of solid stone. You create a 1-inch-thick wall of stone up to 120 feet long, and 20 feet high. You can shape the wall's path, placing each 5 feet of the wall on the border between squares. The wall doesn't need to sand vertically, so you can use it to form a bridge or a set of stairs, for example. You must conjure the wall in an unoccupied space so its endges don't pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost.

Each 10-foot-by-10-foot section of the wall has AC 10, Hardness 14, and 50 Hit Points, and it's immune to critical hits and precision damage. A destroyed section of the wall can be moved through, but the rubble created from it is difficult terrain.
rule.heighten: The Hit Points of each section of the wall increase by 15.

rule.title: Wyvern Sting
rule.line: You duplicate the venomous sting of a wyvern. You deal 3d4 piercing damage to the touched creature, and afflict it with wyvern venom. If the target takes piercing damage, it must attempt a Fortitude save.

line.fail: The creature is afflicted with wyvern venom at stage 1.
line.critfail: The creature is afflicted with wyvern venom at stage 2.
